DataElement.preferredDefinition: A molecular genetic abnormality indicating the presence of a mutation specified by another gene exon not previously identified.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._The result of any gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, including all sequences transcribed into RNA._The sequences of a gene that are present in the final, mature, spliced messenger RNA molecule from that gene.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:The result of any gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, including all sequences transcribed into RNA.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
The result of any gain, loss or alteration of the sequences comprising a gene, including all sequences transcribed into RNA.

Property.preferredDefinition: The sequences of a gene that are present in the final, mature, spliced messenger RNA molecule from that gene.

Concepts.definition: The sequences of a gene that are present in the final, mature, spliced messenger RNA molecule from that gene.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0538595 20C0161 Exon and codon request. 11.17.2020 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A change in the nucleotide sequence of an exon in a gene._Be specific about something; define clearly.
